snippet: Google is developing a maps application for the iPhone and the iPad that it is seeking to finish by the end of the year, according to people involved with the effort.
abstract: Google is developing a maps application for the iPhone and the iPad that it is seeking to finish by the end of the year, according to people involved with the effort.

headline.main: Google Working on Maps for iPhone and iPad

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

snippet: With the revelation that Richard J. Lipsky, convicted of bribery, was assisting federal authorities, officials in Albany and New York City wondered what new scandal might emerge.
abstract: Revelations that lobbyist Richard J Lipsky, convicted of bribing former New York State Senator Carl Kruger, is cooperating with federal authorities suggest that other elected officials could soon find themselves in trouble with the law; at City Hall and in the Capitol, officials appear resigned to the thought that new scandals will emerge.

headline.main: Anticipating Fallout From Lobbyist’s Legal Cooperation
headline.print_headline: Anticipating Fallout From Lobbyist’s Legal Cooperation

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and DAVID W. CHEN

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes Samsung challenging the jury foreman in the Apple patent verdict, questions about Microsoft's energy use at a W...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes Samsung challenging the jury foreman in the Apple patent verdict, questions about Microsoft's energy use at a Washington State data center and to trying to go a full month paying for everything with only a smartphone.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Hacking Public Transit, and Twitter Rethinking Follower Counts

headline.main: Efterklang, Tonight at the Apple Store in SoHo

snippet: Google said it hasn't made a move to restore its maps to the iPhone, but it declined to say whether the company had submitted a new maps app to Apple's App Store. And why would Google show its cards? Here is an opportunity for the company to show ...
abstract: Google said it hasn't made a move to restore its maps to the iPhone, but it declined to say whether the company had submitted a new maps app to Apple's App Store. And why would Google show its cards? Here is an opportunity for the company to show that phones using Android have a more robust maps product. Some of Apple's other competitors are already playing this game.

headline.main: Apple's Competitors Pile On With Map Critiques

snippet: Alternative mapping companies in Japan, like Navitime, are using the opportunity of Apple's less-than-stellar iPhone maps to trumpet their wares.
abstract: Alternative mapping companies in Japan, like Navitime, are using the opportunity of Apple's less-than-stellar iPhone maps to trumpet their wares.

headline.main: Japanese Look for Alternatives to Apple's Maps

abstract: Customers will be able to stream and download movies and television shows for a fee, and store the content in a Nook cloud.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble to Introduce New Video Service for Nook Devices

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and AMY CHOZICK

snippet: Charles Plosser, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, said the Fed’s effort to support the economy probably would fall short of its goals.
abstract: Stocks suffer their biggest decline in three months after Charles I Plosser, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, says he doubts the central bank's effort to bolster economic growth will succeed.

headline.main: Major Indexes Dive After Fed Official Voices Doubt About Stimulus
headline.print_headline: Major Indexes Dive After Fed Official Voices Doubt About Stimulus
